content.description: Priusquam hiems venit, foliafolium, -i, n.: leaf ex arboribus ceciderunt.
content.question: How is the sentence translated?

choices.label: Before winter came, leaves fell from the trees.
When winter came, leaves on the trees had fallen.
Since winter was coming, leaves fell from the trees.
Before the coming of winter, leaves will fall from the trees.

content.answer: Before winter came, leaves fell from the trees.
